reviews.text: Christkindle Market at Kitchener City Hall is a  wonderful German Christmas experience. Usually on for 3 days in early December. Enjoy the wonderful food, shopping and Christmas music. Enjoy outdoor skating too.
Great place to go down with the family and skate around on the ice.
Not very helpful and very disorganized. In the end I had to solve issues by myself.
Great architecture.  On "Hero's Reborn"  excellent views North & South on King & quick walk West to Victoria park.
Great Building and Great Staff.

It is an old building and very nice inside but it is almost totally in accessible to anyone with even a minor handicap. Huge challenging stair way up to the door. They do not even clear their snow at the curb to let a car drop someone and there is no parking for handicapped ticket holders. We drove 40 km to see a concert and were not able to even get out.
Great venue for live music. Quaint and great acoustics!
A great theatre with friendly crew. Price is reasonable for a fun time out. We saw a hilarious, well timed show and can see a good variety of upcoming shows in the brochure.

This is not the Royal Alexandra theatre or the Pantages (or whatever it's called nowadays) so don't expect glamour. Do expect to be entertained by the show on the floor. The seats are a step up from a doctor's waiting room but are comfortable enough for a short performance. The lighting and audio is adequate for the space.
What a beautiful gem on Frederick Street in downtown Kitchener.  This will be the stage for Fred Eaglesmith and Tif Ginn on April 20, 2019.

It is clean and nice facility and the reception is hospital and polite. It contains a lot of arts, mainly paintings. I did had good experience, would have been more nice if there were a devoted guide that share information regarding the art product, if there were a lot of realism copy or original of Canadian or foreigner landscape paintings for exhibit.
Excellent display of beautiful courses and art related to the growing, and blooming, cultures of our town.
This is an awesome place for artist and the community! Every time I go there there are new amazing artworks. It's super affordable and a good place for individuals and families to visit.
Just fine if you enjoy art??🤔
Good art gallery alots of things are there.

Really informative way to see how people other than rich white Victorians (like most historic homes) were living in the 19th Century. There was all sorts of funny or surprising bits of history to learn both for avid history lovers or new learners. Staff were great. I had a wonderful conversation with a young interpreter about Mennonites and the Anishinaabe of the area.

A delightful place that well exceeded my expectations based on some of the older reviews and we certainly felt like we got our money's worth for a highly engaging almost 2-hour visit. The super knowledgeable and enthusiastic interpreters told us so many interesting things and were able to answer our numerous questions. Even though we've been to a few similar kinds of houses in the past we learned so much from the interpreters that you wouldn't have guessed just from looking at the stuff, and sure beat having to read a bunch of explanatory notes for each object. Schneider Haus became part of the government-run parks system I believe about a year ago, and added a bunch of artifacts and opened new areas recently, so if you haven't been in a long while, highly recommend a visit.

We loved our visit here!  Three children and an adult was well worth the $15!  'Joseph' our guide was very knowledgeable and kept the kids very engaged and set them to tasks they would have performed in 1850.  My nice was still talking about it the next day.
Every chance to go here on a field trip, I take it. The staff is so nice and wonderful with the kids.
The staff were knowledgeable and very open to be engaged. A good place to learn.

Tons of things to do for short or long visits.  Prices a little on the higher side which prevents regular visits so I recommend the season pass for frequent visitors which includes the new and improved play structure.  Would love to see a little more in the kids area for younger kids.

Loads of fun, lots of parking. The staff was very helpful, the indoor facility in Kitchener offers activities for the whole family, an indoor play structure, a large arcade with several different types of interactive games, a multi lane bowling alley, with giant TV screens that often stream sporting events, there is a nice size patio with lots of cover from the sun. A nice spot along the Grand River.

There were two events happening when I was here. There was very poor signage both at the road, the parking and once inside there was only a couple of printed paper signs pointing people to the correct location for the activity they wanted to get to. Seems like a very bare bones place with minimal traffic coming through the show.

This is a huge place where you can have large events, corporate parties 🎉, weddings 🎩 and everything between. They have different rooms and different size. They will make it the size you need. I come very often here with my photo booth zattuphotobooth.ca and the staff is always friendly and helpful. They make you feel very welcome. Definitely this is the place if you have large events!

Food is decent enough and the bowling lanes are superb. There's also a game room and an arcade as well as a bar and a really nice patio with tons of parking. Staff are polite and helpful and the bathrooms are well kept. Will visit again for sure.
Great little hidden gem. Food and service was perfect!! Everyone was very friendly. Would recommend it to everyone who enjoys Greek food

Amazing food, friendly staff and speedy service! We had an event here and were very happy with how the evening turned out. They truly made sure all the little details were taken care of; from speedy correspondence in planning the event and ensuring all the details were covered to the night of; where the food tasted great, the staff were welcoming and the service was very timely! Everyone left full and happy!

Great Greek food. A bit on the salty side for the meat I chose though. Atmosphere was quiet when we went. We specifically chose this place because we planned to go to the Centre in the Square performance after and they allow patrons to park in their lot if they ate same night. Walk to the square was less than 5 minutes

I am not Greek, but I visited Greece and I like Greek food and atmosphere.
Limited selection of food and drinks. Even though, the food is mediocre, most likely taken from freezer to microwave.
Party of 5, appetisers, mains, desserts and wine. In terms of food, we ordered pretty much all it was in the menu. No one was really happy with what was in the plates.
Overall cleanness and comfort leaves much to be desired. Men's washroom is not only dated and cramped. It is literally dirty and smelly.
One aspect we liked was the service, which was really good. Also there is free parking available for customers
Highly overrated. I will never get back again under this ownership.
Visited 121518

This place is wonderful we’re located in one of your favourite restaurants. Especially on Symphony night. Food is fantastic the service is over the top and all the servers and staff are friendly. We come to eat here at least once a month. Thank you everyone at the three Kretins.

Atmosphere is meh, overly fluorescent; the food is hit or miss and not worth the price. They aim for fancy but don't fully achieve it. Staff is often really nice but turnover is high. It's not bad by any means, but it misses the mark in too many areas. Rich Uncle, right next door, is higher quality with more reasonable prices and a better atmosphere. Walk the 10 extra paces, in my opinion.

I've attended two beer/food pairing events (one featuring Beau's and the other, Lost Craft) and they were excellent in every way! The format for the event is casual and engaging, with a representative from the brewery and the chef each  giving informative background information on their creations. They welcomed questions and feedback throughout. The setting is perfect - in a separate room that is intimate and very social. We made new friends at each event! 
The food was superb and is an example of the great kitchen they run at TWH. The staff is second to none - especially Danny - in welcoming everyone and attending to all their needs. I've always enjoyed this restaurant, and these events show they can do it better than anyone else!

Thurdays buck a shuck oysters are AMAZING! Best I've had since leaving the west coast. They fresh, brilliant accompaniments, and presentation on the spiced salt is very clever.
Wine and live music pair well. 
I'll definitely be back!

I was here with company for Christmas party a year ago. I thought the place looked very nice! They had live music, which I thoroughly enjoyed. Great location! There's no parking for the restaurant, unless you pay for it and walk for a while. Food was amazing! I would totally recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants some fancy dinning.
Great food, great wine selection. Not super fancy, but nicer than chain places. Not a good place to take kids.

Get coffee and iced tea here daily, staff and drinks are great. Gelato portions are a bit too small IMO. Definitely prefer planet bean in Guelph for that. As far as a coffee shop goes, Matter is my favourite in downtown.

Best beans, best espresso pulls, nicest and most competent baristas around. Make a full assortment of espresso drinks and carry decent gelato and a reasonable pastry assortment. Easily the best coffee shop downtown, good prices too.

Nice independent coffee shop that makes you feel like your at home and not some rushed commercial coffee shop. 
I very much enjoy the speciality teas they offer and an added bonus if you stay inside they provide cups to help save the environment
Very nice atmosphere for sitting and chatting or doing work. Canadian Fog is delicious ! Staff is good at recommending things if you're unsure about what to get or want to try something new.

Good service, delicious tea and a fun, hip ambiance. If you are looking for  decent place downtown I would urgent out to consider a matter of taste. I regrettably did not have a chance to try their treats yet but when next I go, I will definitely try them! (If they are half as tasty as the Irish breakfast tea I had then they will be decadent)
Good selection, helpful staff & fair pricing.
I LIKE THIS STORE TO BUY RELIGOUS THINGS NOT TO EXPENSIVE

Small place, but most botanicals are small. I just wish they had a larger selection of crystals.Great deals on candles AND washes. Whole bottles of washes for $3. Definitely will be returning for a re-up of supplies. Everyone was very nice, and the Padrino seemed very knowledgeable while helping other people that needed specifics. This was just a supply run for me lol
I been going to this place for years. Great guy and very insightful as well as very spiritual.
The owner is honest and knowledgeable of what you need. Strong spiritual vibe that is good.

I don't love the music. I think the food is decent, but I wouldn't go for the food. If I want that type of food, there are better places, but if I want to smoke hookah, and have a tasty bite, definitely a yes. It's a great place to have a smoke and chat with friends.

Went on a Wednesday afternoon, not many customers yet due to the time which called for a relaxing time to study and have a cup of tea. Shisha was so good and the owner was super polite, service was fast. Classic Arabic tunes playing, accompanied by traditional Middle Eastern decorations. Definitely will be returning. :)
Food not too bad! Highly recommend the Kafta plate. Service not too bad! Some of our order was forgotten but overall not bad!
Walked in with my wife , hip hop music blaring .. no one to sit us down and place pretty much empty but one table smoking shisha giving us dirty looks. ,  left immediately.
Great food, friendly staff and amazing atmosphere. Definitely will come back again and recommend anyone to visit and try. 👌👍

I got the black bean soup to go. It was delicious and came with a yummy spiced biscuit / roll. I felt very happy when I received the food. Lots of love went into it! It was ready in less than 5 minutes. Will be coming back!

Enjoyed the Montego Bay wrap this afternoon for lunch. While we were the 1st of only 2 tables we say dine today for lunch the food was fresh, flavourful and complex. This is quick but not "fast" food. Friendly service to boot! Would recommend for sure, just remember it's cash only.

Went here for lunch with co-workers. Didn't dine in. I got 3 small samosas and 3 small fritters all for $4 (including tax). Amazing price and decent quality. The owner had a great vibe. Nice little place.

Nice place and very close to the Kitchener bus terminal. The food is good - our group liked the doubles and the potato Roti. The service was good. They have good options for vegetarians. There are good take out deals and there is more value if your doing take out with the specials they have. Need to have cash as that is the only mode of payment.I stepped in to get takeout.. ok it's a bit of a dive but got my jerk chicken and had great veggies with it that I never seen before but it was  excellent.. the chef came out to say hello.. friendly place but you have to pay cash.. I will definitely go back.. food was excellent

A cozy, unassuming place with food that speaks for itself. I went in for a late lunch and had the entire place to myself. Ordered the hot pepper soup for the appetizer and jerk chicken for the entrée. Both arrived quickly, and were absolutely delicious. The chicken was just right, not too hot, and the owner was considerate to offer their in house hot sauce that added quite a kick to it.

Great ambience, friendly owner, and delicious food. Will definitely come back.

This place really good. . It's gotta be tough to be an artisanal sandwich shop in Carson City in the winter. . But this place has a really good flavor, a broad enough menu for us veggie heads, and a friendly clean operating establishment. If you're stopping through Carson (on your way to the Hot Springs) be sure to grab a sammich here!!

Great food in an intimate, cozy Cafe setting. The panini sandwiches, wraps, quiches, soups and cupcakes are all fresh and incredibly good. It's my favorite place to meet a friend or business associate for a quick lunch.

Great place for lunch.   Had the Italian Combo and a bowl of spicy Chili along with a blueberry crumble muffin.   The sandwich was big and good.   The chili hit the spot considering it was cold outside.  Not to mention,  the Chili was very tasty.   The blueberry crumble muffin was excellent too.   Will be back!
Had the tri-tip and swiss panini, and a mini lemon strawberry cupcake! Very very good. Definitely recommend, as they have a half sandwich and soup or Salad option, for a smaller appetite.
Friendly w many tempting choices!

Very good food. It is usually hit or miss. But so far under new management , great improvement. Server is nice and caring too. 
Still some of work needs to be done like clearing up tables while we eat. 

Over all good experience.

Modern India is one of our go-to curry places. I love the dinner buffet at this little gem of a restaurant. The staff always greets you with a smile and attend to your needs. I completely recommend this restaurant for anyone wanting an authentic taste of Indian cuisine for a very affordable price.
We came here this evening and left very happy! The food is fresh and delicious!  Wonderful and kind  waitress, she is super friendly!  Its very affordable! My new favourite restaurant!

Went there for the first and last time for their lunch buffet. The only contact we had with the server was a smile while he handed us two glasses of water. That was it. No real greeting and didn't check for refills or if we wanted any other drinks while we ate. 

The food was not only bland but served cold. Only the curry chicken was lukewarm at best. Everything else was as if it was taken right from the refrigerator. The ice cream was old and freezer burnt.

The dishes were dirty. Had to pick through a few bowls to find one that wasn't dusty and without dirt. 

Definitely would not recommend eating here.

We are regular customers. The food is authentic, fresh and  tops the best Indian Restaurants near or far. We just had them Cater for a large party, they provided everything including servers and bartender. The owners personally attended to insure that everything was outstanding.  Every guest commented on their professionalism and amazing food. I highly recommend them as the premier option for dining in, takeout or catering small or big events. Moreover excellent service of servers as well as the owner

Incredible lamb shank (Braised Lamb on the menu). I find it's a dish hard to find in Canada and given it's normally higher price, it doesn't usually justify it.

That being said, the lamb shank at Ennio's was delicious! The server was attentive and friendly.

Overall experience was great! I'll be back again soon!

I was craving real Italian pasta. My husband looked up reviews on places nearby and stumbled across this gem.  Someone was reviewing a different restaurant and recommended this restaurant.  We were definitely not disappointed!  My husband thought he was back in grandma's kitchen.  Nice ambiance,  service was great and the food was excellent!  We will definitely be back!

Fresh pasta, decent wine and a warm, cozy environment make for a relaxing , enjoyable outing with good friends. An established name in Kitchener Waterloo that consistently meets expectations. The service is attentive without getting in the way.
Service was great even though it was busy for valentines day. Pleasantly surprised by the quality of food. Was so delicious, and fair prices. We will definitely be back to try more dishes!
We have eaten at Ennio’s multiple times and have absolutely enjoyed it. The food is excellent, and the service is friendly and attentive. We’ll definitely return again!

Very good authentic German food with larger portions. Try their potatoes pancakes as an appetizer, they are sweet and savoury served with onions and apples. Their Ruben is HUGE! and one of the favourites for the regulars. Generally a quiet atmosphere during the lunch hour on weekdays. Even the decor is very authentic as are the outfits the waitresses wear. We were able to make reservations for a table of 16 people without it feeling squished. The staff is friendly and asks as soon as you are seated if you know what drinks you would like. Great place to celebrate Oktoberfest, but tickets sell out fast!
Good German food and entertainment!  Large portions, and reasonable prices. Enjoyed schnitzel, apple strudel and dancing. Nice night out for a family.

This place is so neat... I love going here for some good German food like beef roulade or schnitzel. They have very reasonable prices and their servings are huge!!! They also do a buffet (only on certain days) which is also quite good. They also do Octoberfest there which is lots of fun.
Great food great service.  Best schnitzel in kitchener.
# 1...Home of Oktoberfest! Original, authentic and pure. Excellent schnitzel, but better dancing and bands.
